result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Bynum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 02-23-2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment;
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank-surcharge IMPOSED

With credit for 8 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

***Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successfully completion of the sentence and there are no new violations rising to the level of probable cause***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Bynum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successfully completion of the sentence and there are no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by state, defense and defendant.
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 days in the House of Correction, with 8 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 2/23/2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and there are no new violations rising to the level of probable cause

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice. Student Intern Colin Stevenson under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court via-telephone.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel selected future projected guilty plea off the record.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited. Defendant appeared while warrant being issued. Court withdrew previously issued warrant.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record, 

-CASE PASSED
-CASE RECALLED AT 10:09 A.M.
-SAME APPEARANCES

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.   All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele Dentice in court requesting October 30, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. scheduling conference rescheduled.   Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 37 on November 18, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 10-17-15
Bench warrant in file.

NO possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Joseph M Bynum in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Return on warrant.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Defendant qualifies for public defender.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele Dentice contacted the the Court to reschedule September 8, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37 on October 7, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court, attorney Angele R. Dentice contacted via-telephone. Defense counsel was unaware of this case. Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Joseph M Bynum in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Joseph M Bynum in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
